entry.title: Re: MR11 Issue
entry.content:
Ok in that case, recheck the following:-

Go to PO History tab to confirm all GR and IR entries are posted correctly. The GR/IR clearing account still shows an open item for the $0.95. No residual quantities or values are pending. If the GR/IR account is already cleared, MR11 won’t post anything.

Check Delivery Cost Condition Type Configuration and ensure that the delivery cost condition type (e.g., DCGR) is:

  • marked with Condition Category = B (Delivery Costs) in transaction M/06
  • Properly linked to the delivery cost account in OBYC (FR1, FR2, etc.)
  • Not set as statistical, which would prevent it from being posted

If the condition type is incorrectly configured, MR11 may not pick up the delivery cost variance correctly.

When executing MR11, make sure you select the checkbox for delivery costs on the selection screen. You include the correct PO number and item. You run MR11 in test mode first, then in update mode. If delivery costs are not selected, MR11 may ignore the variance even if it exists.

Run transaction MR11SHOW to view all open GR/IR differences, confirm that the $0.95 is listed as a delivery cost variance. Identify if the system is blocking the posting due to missing quantity or config

Also SAP Note 728362 which addresses incorrect clearing values for delivery costs

entry.title: Re: Using data-gigya-api-link in screensets to call APIs...
entry.content:
Hi @damianomilani ,

 

You have 2 options.

1. use the link element, to use the link element and add the "provider" property, you must pass it in the showScreenSet request and it will be picked up automaticlly.

2. use our button element, and implement the onButtonClicked event (see https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CUSTOMER_DATA_CLOUD/8b8d6fffe113457094a17701f63e3d6a/aac686baa2f14a38812765f2a28dc315.html?q=onButtonClicked), this way you can customize it to your own needs.

 

Note: regarding the documentation of "data-gigya-api-link", we will take it with the relevant people to update the Doc accordingly.

entry.title: Are you familiar with the steps required to prepare for integrating SAP Entitlement Management?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Integrating SAP Entitlement Management  learning journey.

Overview

This learning journey will prepare you to understand SAP EMS Integration Scenarios.

Learning objectives

This course will prepare you to:

  • Understand the Fundamentals of EMS Integration Scenarios
  • Use EMS integration with APIS
  • Configure the event mesh for SAP S/4HANA integration
  • Replicate master data from S/4HANA
  • Replicate a sales order from SAP S/4HANA using IDOC
  • Replicate a sales order from SAP S/4HANA using Event Mesh
  • Trigger an entitlement provisioned event to SAP S/4HANA
  • Enhance integration between SAP S/4HANA and EMS
  • Configure credentials for EMS and Wibu-Systems CodeMeter integration
  • Request ticket generation from CodeMeter License Central
  • Receive Activation State of License from CodeMeter License Central
  • Configuring an event mesh for SAP S/4HANA Cloud integration
  • Integrate with SAP Subscription Billing
  • Replicate master data from SAP Subscription Billing
  • Outline SAP Subscription Billing and Entitlement Management Integration
  • Exploring integration design
  • Enhance integration between SAP Subscription Billing and EMS
  • Perform troubleshooting for EMS integrations

Prerequisites

Essential:

  • Foundation Knowledge of SAP EMS
  • Integration Common Sense

Recommended:

  • CPI Development Skill
  • BTP Foundation Knowledge
  • Integration Target System Knowledge

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

entry.title: Re: Creating a completely custom form in SAP Public Cloud...
entry.content:
Hello @LDB 

Thank you for raising this question. I understand you want to generate a fully customised label when a production order is completed in your MES system, and that no suitable template exists within the provided forms.

In SAP S/4HANA Public  Cloud, the main points are:

  • Custom forms are supported: You can upload your own XDP file into the Maintain Form Templates app and render it with the SAP Forms service by Adobe. While the common practice is to copy and modify SAP templates, it is also possible to create a form from scratch and bind your own fields.
  • There is no standard FDP (form data provider) for operation-completion labels: Unlike Goods Receipt labels, there is no predefined form interface for production operation confirmations. This means you cannot simply enable a new form in Output Parameter Determination.
  • How to provide data for the label: You must supply the data context yourself. The usual supported patterns are
    1. BTP-centric: MES invokes a small service on SAP BTP that transmits MES/SAP data to Adobe's Forms service and prints through Cloud Print Manager.
    2. S/4 extension (RAP): Create a RAP business object or action in S/4 that gathers production order or operation data and invokes the Forms service. MES can trigger this API when the order is finished.
    3. Confirmation API hook: MES employs the standard Production Order Confirmation API (API_PROD_ORDER_CONFIRMATION_2_SRV) to submit the completion to S/4. Your extension logic then initiates the form rendering and printing as a side effect.
  • Binding fields: In all cases, the fields on your custom XDP label are linked to the payload you send at runtime (order, operation, batch, characteristics, etc.). Since there is no standard operation-confirmation FDP, you control the payload either in BTP or in your RAP service.
  • Printing: Labels are generated through the Forms service by Adobe and sent to your printers via SAP Cloud Print Manager, which is the standard printing mechanism in Public Cloud.

Summary: You can build a fully custom label from scratch in Public Cloud by uploading a custom XDP to the Forms service by Adobe and rendering it from either a BTP service or a small RAP extension. There isn’t a standard operation-confirmation label interface, so the usual pattern is:
(A) MES → BTP → Forms service → print, or
(B) MES → S/4 RAP → Forms service → print, or
(C) MES → Production Order Confirmation API in S/4, then your extension prints the label.
See: Maintain/Custom Form Templates (Help), Printing mission (BTP + Cloud Print Manager), and Production Order Confirmation API for the MES call

 Let me know if you need further assistance

With kind regards

Chuma

GenAI assistance content for SAP is useful, with references being official and recent.

  • Maintain / Create Custom Form Templates (Public Cloud Help). SAP Help Portal
  • Work with Standalone Forms (Learning). SAP Learning
  • Printing mission (BTP + Cloud Print Manager + Forms service). SAP Discovery Center
  • Public Cloud 2508 – Feature Scope/Docs hub. SAP Help Portal
  • Production Order Confirmation API (for MES integration). SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Developer extensibility example: generate PDFs with Forms service (Public Cloud). SAP Community

entry.title: Lab Space - SAP Signavios platform to explore early-stage ideas and AI features
entry.content:
What is SAP Signavio Lab Space?

SAP Signavio Lab Space is a secure, cost-free innovation platform where customers can explore early-stage ideas and AI-powered features before they are generally available. It provides a safe environment to test prototypes with your own data in a controlled, non-production setup without any impact on your live systems.

You’ll find multiple prototypes available for experimentation, ranging from process modeling enhancements to AI-driven tools. While not every prototype will become part of the official product, your feedback directly shapes the future of SAP Signavio solutions.

Access to Lab Space requires an Enterprise or Enterprise Plus license and signing a Test & Evaluation Agreement (TEA) via SAP’s secure process. Once approved, you can explore each prototype for 90 to 180 days, depending on availability.

The best part? Lab Space is 100% free with no hidden fees and no AI unit consumption. To get started, simply request access through your Customer Success Partner or send an email to signavio_lab_space@sap.com. 

In short: Lab Space is your opportunity to co-innovate with SAP, experiment with new features early, and directly influence the roadmap of SAP Signavio.

Key Benefits for You

  • Early Access – Be among the first to explore SAP Signavio’s newest innovations

  • Hands-on Testing – Try prototypes in a safe, controlled environment without impacting your production systems.

  • Direct Influence – Provide feedback directly to SAP Signavio product teams and help shape solutions for the community.

  • Safe & Trusted Environment – Your data is always protected, giving you peace of mind while experimenting.

  • No Cost, No AI Units – 100% free, with no hidden fees or charges.

How to Access

  1. License Needed

    • Available for SAP Signavio Enterprise or Enterprise Plus customers.

  2. Request Access

    • Contact your Customer Success Partner or email:
      📧signavio_lab_space@sap.com

  3. Legal Agreement

    • Sign the Test & Evaluation Agreement (TEA) by an authorized person.

  4. Validity

    • Access each prototype for 90 or 180 days, depending on availability.

 

Step-by-Step Guide to Getting Started

Step 1: Find Lab Space

  • Log into your SAP Signavio environment.

  • In the Global Side Navigation, select Lab Space.

  • The Lab Space environment opens — your launchpad for prototypes.

  •  

Step 2: Request Access

  1. Choose an application to test

    • Browse the available prototypes (e.g., Text to Process, Landscape Builder, Dictionary Doctor).

    • Click Enable Application.

  2. Copy your Workspace ID

    • Open your profile menu (top-right corner).

    • Copy your Workspace ID.

  3. Send your request

    • Follow the on-screen instructions.

    • Or email signavio_lab_space@sap.com with:

      • Your Workspace ID

      • The application name you want to test

Step 3: Complete the Legal Step

  1. Receive TEA link – The Lab Space team will send you a link.

  2. Review & sign – Check with your legal team if needed. Each prototype set requires its own agreement.

  3. Return signed – Once returned, you’ll immediately get access.

 

Step 4: Start Exploring

  • Access granted – After approval, the application appears in your Lab Space.

  • Experiment – Launch directly and test.

  • Share feedback – Use the Feedback button in the bottom-right corner anytime.

 

Bonus Tip: Where to Start?

Try out these popular prototypes first:

  • Text to Proces – Turn text into process models in seconds. 

     

  • Landscape Builder – Visualize and manage your system landscape.

  • Dictionary Doctor – Improve consistency and clarity of business terms.

In Summary

SAP Signavio Lab Space gives you a safe and cost-free way to explore early-stage prototypes, including AI-powered features, for up to 180 days. You can test directly with your own data in a non-production environment, provide feedback to our product teams, and help shape future SAP Signavio solutions.

Not every prototype will become part of the product, but your input is an important part of the innovation process ensuring that what we build reflects real customer needs.

With Lab Space, you get hands-on experience, early insights, and the chance to influence tomorrow’s business processes.

entry.title: Issue with Purchase Price Variance Posting in SAP ByDesign
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing an issue in SAP Business ByDesign related to product valuation during the procurement process.

Here’s the scenario:

  • In the product master data, under Valuation, we maintain a cost price of 1 Naira.
  • When creating a Purchase Order, we may buy the product at a different price (for example, 1,000 Naira per unit).
  • After posting the Goods Receipt, we noticed that the system splits the posting as follows:
    • Debit Material: 1.00 NGN
    • Credit Goods not yet Invoiced: 1000.00 NGN
    • Debit Difference in purchasing: 999.00 NGN

Our expectation is that the entire 1,000 Naira should be debited to the Material (inventory) account, not split between product valuation and purchase price difference.

Question:
How can we configure or treat this so that the full purchase price is capitalized in inventory, instead of posting most of it to the “purchase price difference” account?

Any guidance on the correct setup or configuration would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Data transfer from multiple models to one common mode...
entry.content: Sowmiya, What you intend to do is a data join between 2 models. Its not a data copy requirement. You can do it using LINK statement. In the Target Model, use LINK statement to read the ERS rate from Source Model. You can achieve the Data join my multiplying the 2 data records. Use the Annual Salary record to create a factor of 1 ( Annual Salary/Annual Salary * LINK ( ERS Factor) ). Refer to documentation for syntax.

entry.title: Re: Disable the automatic settlement of production/Proces...
entry.content:
To answer your question Can You Disable or Control It?, the answer is No not directly, but here are your options:

If you are migrating from BEI (Period-End Closing - Plant) to 3F0, SAP recommends reviewing which order types need manual control, reconfiguring those to use classic settlement. Keeping event-based logic only for standard production flows. SAP’s blog by @GraceZou  on transitioning to event-based production accounting outlines this strategy

Use Order Type Configuration to Exclude Specific Orders so that SAP allows you to define order types that are not event-based. For these, you can retain traditional settlement logic (e.g., CO88 at period-end). This means you can segregate business cases by assigning different order types. You’ll need to check whether your system supports both event-based and classic accounting side-by-side. In Public Cloud, this may be restricted.

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
Hi Bernd,

thanks a lot for the reference. This makes it at least a bit more current and official.

---

In addition I would like to share further logic regarding the transition and impact analysis to everybody. From our point of view many users are heavily affected and we now have to scan applications for default IdP usage as many of our users have multiple users under UID. Full reply with helpful guidance (no official statement!):

That is correct, we are moving to the old approach where S/P users will login individually with their SAP ID passwords and that is the whole change.

UID password will remain as password for account.sap.com as the wallet where individuals can manage their S/P users and SAP ID passwords.

And when the feature will be launched, on the first login users will see the migration window once with each linked user listed and option to inherit UID password/keep current/create new for SAP ID password. 

It is not supposed to affect the process of deletion of S-users when person leaves.

It only affects the login process after migration passed, in SAP ID it is recommended to use ID instead of email when there are multiple users associated with same email (like in your case with [****@****.*** ). Multiple users for same email can have the same SAP ID password, in this case login with email+password will lead to error (multiple users meet the criteria).

For now, we do not yet have a public page about this feature since it is not live. I will get back with this later.

----

We received another feedback from support about go-live date:

There is no such public page for project timeline about SAP ID Password migration, we expect the release today-tomorrow [Peter: 26th August?]. Users will see migration screens with instructions when those will be activated by UID team.

I am looking forward to the joyride in case SAP partner applications are also affected but hope there are solutions to it.

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Disable the automatic settlement of production/Proces...
entry.content:
Hi @Amit66, @Lakshmipathi,

Since S/4HANA Cloud 2502, a manual settlement option is introduced for event-based production orders, process orders, and product cost collectors. It allows you to disable the postings that are triggered by business events in real time, instead, you settle the orders by manually running the Manual Settlement: Event-Based Order and PCC job in Schedule Product Costing Jobs at the period end.

For more info, see https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4032610758dc437089f0c28320eec93f/1171ebffae444d9fa9072364aae1b070.html?version=2502.500.

Best regards,

Grace

entry.title: Re: Skip step in flexible PO workflow
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question. 

Can you please whether the following procedure (GenAI was used to help generate this content) is what you need?

To implement a flexible PO approval process using BADI MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2, you can follow these steps:

  1. Define Approval Levels:

    • Level 1: Approver 1 for variance between 30% and 50%.
    • Level 2: Approvers 1 and 2 for variance between 50% and 90%.
    • Level 3: Approvers 1, 2, and 3 for variance greater than 90%.

  2. Manage Workflow Steps:

    • Predefine three levels of approval in the ‘Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders’ app.

  3. BADI Implementation:

    • Use BADI MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 for agent determination Sourcing and Procurement - Workflow Features for Purchase Orders based on the variance.
    • Ensure that the logic correctly assigns approvers based on the variance conditions.

  4. Handling Empty Approver Lists:

    • If the variance falls between 30-50%, only Level 1 approval is needed. Ensure that the BADI logic skips Level 2 and Level 3 if no approvers are determined.
    • You can use the StepInfo parameter in the BADI to check the current step and skip steps where no approvers are determined.

  5. Automatic Approval for Variance < 30%:

    • Set a condition at the workflow level for automatic approval if the variance is less than 30%.

  6. Custom Conditions:

    • Since BADI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF allows only one condition ID, consider using custom logic to handle step-level conditions within the BADI implementation. Available Cloud BADIs for Purchase Requisition Flexible Workflow
[1] Sourcing and Procurement - Workflow Features for Purchase Orders
[2] Available Cloud BADIs for Purchase Requisition Flexible Workflow
 
Kind regards,
Henrike

entry.title: Re: Purpose of "authorized to teach"
entry.content:
Good morning,

The "Authorized to Teach" field serves to define which trainings an instructor is qualified to deliver. This way, through the "My Classes" functionality, the instructor can record attendance directly, without the need to create a class beforehand.

This is especially useful in situations when there is an opportunity to train — for example, if some operators have downtime and the instructor decides to provide a necessary training on the spot. Instead of requesting the creation of a formal class so just after the instructor register the attendance list, the instructor can immediately register the training in the employees' history using My Classes.

However, this functionality is only available to instructors who are already registered in the system as instructors, and only for the list of trainings that are already pre-assigned to their Authorized to Teach list.

I hope this answer helps you!

entry.title: Re: Guidance on Building an APK for SAP Fiori Application...
entry.content:
Hi @KhazaMohammad71 

SAP Fiori Client is deprecated and no longer a viable solution. It's not enhanced by SAP for a long time and not supported.

The best practice option when it comes to Zebra is to run your Fiori UI5 HTML apps, or Work Zone launchpad, inside "Zebra Enterprise Browser" which is a native Android application from Zebra that is very similar to SAP Fiori Client. You put the URL of your Fiori web app or Work Zone launchpad inside Zebra Enterprise Browser and it is displayed in a web view inside the app. Enterprise Browser is available from Zebra via download or Google Play, it's a commercial product that requires a paid license. Note that you can use the "sap.ndc" SAPUI5 library for barcode scanning - it will auto detect what client it is running inside, if it detects Zebra Enterprise Browser it will interact with the hardware scanner, otherwise if it's in a web browser it will fire the camera to scan barcodes. Or you can interact with the Zebra hardware scanner from UI5 using Zebra's API's directly when inside Enterprise Browser.

The advantage of Enterprise Browser is that it exposes multiple Zebra hardware functions, incl the scanner, as JavaScript APIs which you can interact with from your UI5 JavaScript code. I have developed this in the past and it works very well. It's also supported by Zebra.

If you don't like that approach, another approach is to use regular Apache Cordova which SAP Fiori client is built upon, although that project is pretty quiet nowadays, most people have moved on from Cordova. But if you use Cordova you can install an Android Intent Cordova Plugin inside your app and communicate with Zebra DataWedge via Intents to send/receive scans programmatically. This is how we used Fiori Client for years and it works well. Using Intents and DataWedge is the current best practice from Zebra for interacting with their hardware scanners.

Another alternative is Ionic Capacitor, which is compatible with a large amount of Cordova plugins. You can create an app there in the same way as a Cordova app, including your Fiori web app inside it. Capacitor is a lot more active than Cordova. Ionic also have native Zebra barcode scanning capability in Capacitor (using DataWedge), exposing JavaScript APIs to be used in SAPUI5. But, Ionic charge a license fee for the Zebra integration as it's classed as an Enterprise offering from them. But if you didn't want to pay, you could use an Android Intents plugin and communicate with Zebra DataWedge in the same way as Cordova.

And with regards to the previous comment about using Mobile Start. It's not possible to programmatically interact with the Zebra hardware scanner as Mobile Start has no plugin technology and Zebra do not provide JavaScript APIs unless you are running inside Zebra's Enterprise Browser.

Regards,

Brendan

entry.title: Re: Implementing UI5 Search Field for Virtual Elements
entry.content: Thank you for pointing this out — you are absolutely right that, in general, filtering, sorting, and pagination should always be pushed down to the backend. The Fiori framework and SADL are designed exactly for that purpose, and client-side filtering can indeed lead to misleading results when working with large datasets. In my scenario, however, the requirement was a bit different: the field in question is a virtual/derived element that does not exist in the database and is therefore not filterable through OData. Because of that limitation, backend filtering isn’t an option in this case. The table in which this requirement applies also has a relatively small result set (object-page level, scoped context), which makes client-side filtering practical and safe. That said, I fully agree that this approach should only be considered for small datasets and when backend filtering is not possible. For larger datasets, backend-driven filtering remains the best practice.

entry.title: Re: Preveventive Maintenance Plan pause, re-start and tra...
entry.content:
Hi @T_Lindgren 

Your scenarios are very common in Preventive Maintenance in S/4HANA Public Cloud. Here are the recommended practices:

  1. Put a Preventive Maintenance Plan on Pause and Restart Later

In Public Cloud you cannot pause a plan directly, but you can control scheduling so no new calls are generated during the pause:

Here are suggested best Practices:

  • Block or deactivate the plan temporarily
    • In the Change Maintenance Plan app, set the Scheduling Indicator = Inactive or use Blocking so that the scheduler skips this plan.
  • Restart later
    • When ready for example after 6 months, reactivate the scheduling indicator. The system will calculate the next due package based on the scheduling cycle and last completion.
  • This ensures the plan remains in the system but does not generate orders during the pause.

Change of Maintenance Plan Data

 

  1. Postpone Only One Next Call in a Strategy Plan

Sometimes you need to shift only the next cycle, without permanently changing the strategy.

These are the suggested best Practices:

  • Manual Adjustment of Call Dates
    • Use Display or Change Maintenance Plan Schedule app → select the due call → adjust the planned date forward by +6 months.
  • Completion rescheduling
    • When you complete a call/order, the next call is normally scheduled forward based on the strategy. If you want to add a one-time delay, adjust the completion date in the confirmation, which shifts the cycle.
  • Use Offset or Shift Factors
    • In the maintenance plan parameters, you can allow manual date shifting by entering a shift factor. This provides controlled flexibility to postpone one cycle without redesigning the whole plan.

Scheduling Parameters

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Fiori not calling Odata. RAP Preview working fine
entry.content:
Hi,

In my current project, I’m developing a SAP Fiori app using Visual Studio Code. However, the main challenge is that VS Code isn’t connected to the SAP backend. To work around this, I’m downloading an existing app using the standard program /UI5/UI5_REPOSITORY_LOAD, making the necessary changes locally, and then uploading it back to the SAP backend using the same program. This process creates a BSP application.

The backend OData service has been generated using RAP. When I preview the service binding in Eclipse, everything works perfectly—the OData call is successful, and the view is rendered correctly. 

The Network tab in the Edge browser’s Developer Tools confirms this, as shown in the screenshot. No issues so far.

To replicate this behavior in my standalone Fiori app, I checked the source in the app preview to identify the URI being called.

I then used this exact URI in the manifest.json file of my app in VS Code. The screenshot below shows the manifest.json from my standalone VS Code project.

However, when I test the app using SE80 (by right-clicking and selecting Test in SAPGUI after uploading), the OData service isn’t being called, and the view isn’t generated. The screen remains blank. The Network tab in Edge shows no OData activity, and although the Console logs some generic errors, they also appear in other working apps.

I’ve checked all the usual places for errors—/IWFND/ERROR_LOG, ST22, SLG1, and SU53—but found nothing relevant.

Network in Developer tool of the Edge browser doesn't show any Odata call.

Console shows some error, but these are generic error which I can see in other apps as well which are working just fine.

I’m stuck at this point and would really appreciate any guidance on what might be going wrong or what else I can check.

Thanks,

entry.title: Re: Query on Advanced Return Management for Service and N...
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

There is no specific OSS note for this. The error is a standard system behaviour.

  • Movement Type 657 pertains to stock-relevant returns in ARM.
  • Service (TATX) and NLAG (non-stock) items do not have inventory postings, so ARM results in an Invalid Movement Type error 657.

Possible workaround: process these items through a standard return order (without ARM), referencing the original invoice.

With Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: New Features: Dark Mode (Beta) and Events Listings
entry.content:
I’m back to report a couple new improvements to SAP Community – one that makes it more convenient to find events that interest you, and another that addresses a popular accessibility request from our feedback list.

Consolidation of Events

A community goes beyond a website. It also includes events – both online and in-person – that allow people to come together to learn and connect.

If you’re a community member who enjoys webinars, SAP CodeJam sessions, meet-ups, and more, then you know that you’ve previously needed to comb through various sections to find events that appeal to you…especially in your area. There’s a general Events page, but there are also (as an example) events available through location groups. You couldn’t go to a single place on SAP Community to find every upcoming event.

Until now.

In the past, the “View all Events” option, accessible from the “Events” pulldown menu, only offered filtering for event types (e.g., Devtoberfest, SAP CodeJam), event status (e.g., in progress, upcoming), and labels (e.g., physical, online). If you wanted to find other specific meetups and events convenient for you, you had to visit the location groups within your vicinity. Thanks to improvements rolled out today, however, the View all Events page now truly shows all events, including those hosted by location groups.

We’ve expanded the Events page with filtering options for countries, making it easier for you to find even more educational and social activities close to you by pulling details from the location groups. We’ve also added a filter for SAP Managed Tags that allows you to get very specific when searching for events that match your interests.

As an example, as an American, I’d love to get together with other community members at an in-person event happening near me. So for my search of events, I selected United States (for the country), SAP Community (as the tag), physical (as a label), and upcoming (as the event status) – and, lucky me, looks like I found a cool get-together right by my office at SAP’s American headquarters in Newtown Square, Pennsylvania! (OK, that’s a made-up event from our test site, but I sure would love to participate if it were real – especially if that dog is attending, too.)

If you’d rather not refine your search with that level of granularity, you can make multiple selections from every filter. Get as focused, or as broad, as you want. Switch between list and calendar displays while you’re at it. Play around with the various options, and we hope to see you at an event very soon!

Introducing Dark Mode (Beta)

You asked for it.

You got it.

Mostly.

Our platform now offers a dark-mode option, but it’s in a beta phase – meaning we’re still working on features and working out some issues.

More on those in a bit. First, I want to explain how to turn dark mode on.

After logging in (log-in is required), open the pulldown menu from the person icon in the upper right, then select “Switch to Dark Mode (BETA)”:

You’ll immediately see the site in dark mode, although some elements of the site, such as headers and menus, remain in light mode.

As we refine this option during the beta phase, we’ll apply dark mode to all parts of the site. Also, we’ll fix an issue with replies in discussions and direct messages. At the moment, the text in these replies is too dark to see easily.

We’re aware of the problem, and we should have it resolved before the end of the week.

Beyond those minor items, the beta is up and available for you to try out. Switch dark mode on and see what you think.

Don’t like it? Just go back to the pulldown and select “Switch to Light Mode” to return to the platform’s default look and feel.

Experiment to see which experience works best for you, and remember that we’ll continue to make refinements to dark mode during the beta phase.

entry.title: Re: Integration of Sales Order Scheduling w/o sales order...
entry.content:
We raised an OSS and we received the solution. 

Create a custom control key with SD-TM integration, assign your duration profile.

Assign the required sales order documents to the control key.

Now update the TM control key again --> remove SD-TM.

 

Now, SAP can determine the relevant sales orders for scheduling feature but does not create order-based freight units.

It's more a workaround than a customizing documentation, but I'm sure SAP will optimize their documentation after our OSS.

entry.title: Re: Java heap space error in XI repository
entry.content: The “java heap space” error means that the system has run out of memory while handling your repository operations. As the error name says, this usually happens when the default memory allocated to the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is not sufficient or also when the objects being saved or processed are large. In order to resolve this, you can do a simple step, just give a try to increase the heap size in the JVM parameters of your application server so that it has more memory available to process repository objects. It’s really a good idea to review the repository content for very large mappings or objects that may be consuming excessive memory and optimize them if possible. Once the memory settings are adjusted, the issue should be resolved and saving objects in the repository should become smoother. You can check out this blog How to Solve OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space to understand more about this Java Heap Space error

entry.title: Como foi participar do SAP NOW AI TOUR BRAZIL 2025
entry.content:
Nos dias 19 e 20 de agosto aconteceu em São Paulo o SAP NOW Brasil 2025, reunindo mais de 3.000 participantes e mais de 300 sessões sobre inovação, tecnologia e transformação digital no ecossistema SAP.

O evento destacou como a inteligência artificial já está integrada ao SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP e Business AI, trazendo casos reais de empresas que vêm alcançando resultados expressivos com soluções em nuvem.

O evento contou com empresas de Santa Catarina, como a Ramo Sistemas (Joinville, SC) e a MakeValue (Joinville, SC), parceira e patrocinadora que apresentou cases de conectividade bancária no SAP.

Foi uma oportunidade única de vivenciar a organização de um grande evento SAP e acompanhar de perto a interação entre clientes, parceiros e comunidade.

A edição de 2025 reforçou o quanto a comunidade SAP segue ativa, colaborativa e comprometida em cocriar o futuro dos negócios.

entry.title: Re: Declaration 390 - EC Sales List Romania
entry.content:
Hello @JAS3311 

Thanks for following up; everything is working as expected in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Here’s a breakdown of the process, with references for added clarity.

Here's an update on the EU Tip Code and what you should be aware of.

  • In the Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting app, you can easily add or remove tax codes and assign them to reporting groups. However, please note that you cannot directly edit the EU transaction code like “L”, “T”, “A”, “P”, “S” because that logic is built into the system. system.help.sap.com
  • The assignment of the EU code “tip” occurs automatically. It is based on the underlying properties of the tax code and the type of transaction. Therefore, you cannot override it by default.

Here's a quick look at what the Run Preview Override does. It's a handy feature that helps you see how things will look before finalising. This makes planning and adjustments much easier, giving you more confidence in your work.

  • If you see something like “A → L” during the Run Preview, that is purely a temporary, simulation-based override for that preview run. It doesn’t stick; it doesn’t change default system behaviour or persist in your system configuration.

Adjusting Default Settings: An Explanation of the Process

  • Since the EU code assignment is part of the system logic and isn't accessible for customer configuration in the public cloud edition, you cannot modify it directly.
  • To modify the default mapping, you need to either open an SAP Incident or submit a configuration or change request via SAP support. Self-service configuration for this mapping is not available option.

SAP documentation reference: SAP Help Portal – Declaration 390 (Romania)-section Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: How do I make DOX learn?
entry.content:
Hi 

I trying to load some purchase orders with different layouts. I Need to extract at least one field that is not included in the SAP standard schema (EAN no.), so I made a copy of the SAP_purchaseOrder_schema and added the ean header field to the copy.

The new field can have setup type Manual or Auto (with a default extractor). As I understand the documentation, a custom field must have setup type Manual. Also I understand that only setup type Auto will use the AI functionality and if I chose Manual setup type, I must make a template. Does this mean that fields with Auto are handled by the AI and fields with Manual are depending on the template?

So I have made the new field with setup type Manual and I have made a template.

Then I uploaded a file. Some data was extracted wrongly so I entered Edit mode and corrected the errors and saved the document again. Then I addet the document to the template.

Now I expected DOX to have learned from the corrections I made, but if I load exactly same document again, it still makes the same errors.

So, can anyone explain how DOX can learn and what setup influence the learning and what I can to to teach DOX?

Also I would like to understand, if I have 3 purchase orders with 3 very different layouts, can I handle this by adding the 3 documents to one template or must I create 3 templates or is it even better to create 3 different schemas?

I hope it is allright that I asked 3 questions in this thread as I think they are all related to the subject - how does DOX learn and fix extraction errors?

Kind Regards 
Thomas Madsen Nielsen

entry.title: SAP MaxAttention IWS 'Accelerate your business transformation - Integrated Toolchain' (Sep 24, 2025)
entry.content:
Virtual

September 24, 2025

Agenda

Dear Valued Customer,

We are pleased to invite you to the SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop focusing on ‘Accelerate your business transformation with the Integrated Toolchain’ virtually taking place on September 24, 2025. Please find the current agenda here.

In today's rapidly evolving business landscape, organizations are constantly seeking innovative solutions to drive transformation and maintain competitive advantage. SAP Integrated Toolchain is a collection of SAP and partner tools designed to support all phases of a digital transformation journey. This workshop aims to showcase how the Toolchain, based on powerful solutions including SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, SAP Cloud ALM, Tricentis, and WalkMe, can streamline the transition from legacy systems to a cloud-based intelligent enterprise. Together, these tools provide a cohesive set of solutions for business process analysis, architecture planning, testing, and user enablement.

The integrated approach offered by SAP helps customers reduce transformation costs, accelerate time to value, and foster continuous innovation. Additionally, customers can leverage support from SAP MaxAttention to drive adoption of the Toolchain and ensure successful implementation. Attendees will gain comprehensive insights into leveraging this suite to optimize their business operations, enhance decision-making capabilities, and achieve sustainable growth. Through expert-led sessions, real-world case studies, and interactive demonstrations, participants will explore the full potential of SAP's Toolchain to navigate and succeed in their transformative business initiatives. Join us to discover how SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, SAP Cloud ALM, Tricentis, and WalkMe, combined with SAP MaxAttention support, can collectively pave the way for your organization's digital excellence.

The health and well-being of our customers, employees, and business partners is a top priority for SAP. We offer a virtual event format which allows you to have an interactive, digital experience, in a safe environment.

Our Workshops

These sessions and workshop series focus on a specific topic and the purpose is to enable our customers to understand the product portfolio and innovative technologies of SAP in order to drive adoption and consumption. As specifically now, it is more important than ever to help companies to be successful and to respond to changing markets by transforming into intelligent enterprises in the experience economy.

Important

Please note that the 'Attend' button which can be found within this blog post does not serve as a formal registration for the event.

To officially register, please reach out to me, paul.schropp@sap.com and I will ensure that your registration is properly processed.

We look forward to having you join us for our upcoming events and thank you for your understanding!

Your feedback

Feel free to share your feedback and thoughts in the comment section below.

entry.title: ODATA Services Cache control settings
entry.content:
Hello,

We have received request from third party system - middleware team for changes in cache control of OData service's specific entity sets. Below are comments from them- 

This header is restricting clients not to cache the response .

We don’t get the header while getting the metadata

We checked below configurable settings for ODATA but not sure how and where to maintain it.

Appreciate your help and guidance.

Regards,

Padmaja


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: ODATA Services Cache control settings
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

   You can use the documentation mentioned on the case https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/68bf513362174d54b58cddec28794093/05fb2651c294256ee10000000a445394.html

   I have found other ways to limit the cache control as well,

 

In Node.js, you can use middleware to modify the headers for specific OData entity set routes.

  1. Add Middleware to Handle Cache Control for Specific Routes:

    const express = require('express');
const odataServer = require('odata-server');
const app = express();

// Middleware to set cache-control headers for a specific entity set
const noCacheMiddleware = (req, res, next) => {
    if (req.path.startsWith('/MyEntitySet')) {
        res.set('Cache-Control', 'no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate');
        res.set('Pragma', 'no-cache');
        res.set('Expires', '0');
    }
    next();
};

// Use the middleware
app.use(noCacheMiddleware);

// Your OData configuration
const model = require('./model'); // Your OData model
const odata = odataServer(model);

app.use(odata);

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;
app.listen(PORT, () => {
    console.log(`Server is running on port ${PORT}`);
});

    If you have a controller that inherits from ODataController, you might want to override the ExecuteAsync method to add the Cache-Control headers.

    public class MyODataController : ODataController
{
    public override async Task<HttpResponseMessage> ExecuteAsync(HttpControllerContext controllerContext, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
    {
        HttpResponseMessage response = await base.ExecuteAsync(controllerContext, cancellationToken);

        response.Headers.CacheControl = new CacheControlHeaderValue
        {
            NoCache = true,
            NoStore = true,
            MustRevalidate = true
        };
        response.Headers.Pragma.ParseAdd("no-cache");
        response.Headers.Expires = DateTimeOffset.UtcNow.AddYears(-1);

        return response;
    }
}


    If this solutions solve this case you can close this post. If not we can continue discussing over here.

    Best Regards,
    Lucas

entry.title: Re: Company DB is not consistent; see log [Message 131-21...
entry.content:
Hi Joo_Leo

To investigate this issue: Please attach the 3 log files and the relevant information from Note 2380811

Mandatory Information required for SAP Business One Upgrade Incident .

If in your environment the upgrade still fails please attach the 3 log files from Note 2380811- Mandatory Information required for SAP Business One Upgrade Incident .
1. Setup.SetupWizard.xxxxxxxx_xxxxxx.pidxxxx.log.csv - SetupLogFile of the Wizard with results of the pre&post upgrade checks
2. Setup.b1logger.xxxxxxxx_xxxxxx.pidxxxx.log.csv - SetupLogFile of the whole upgrade process
3. Setup.B1Setup.xxxxxxxx_xxxxxx.pidxxxx.log.csv - SetupLogFile of the whole upgrade process

We suggest to create the support case using component SBO-BC-UPG with above logs to check this issue further.

Kind Regards
Nidhi
SAP Support

entry.title: Power BI using SAP BW Application Server
entry.content:
Hello,

I’m looking for some hands-on experiences and advice regarding connecting Power BI to SAP BW/4HANA using the SAP BW Application Server connector.

I have tested both Direct Query and Import options, but the performance is extremely poor:

  • Expanding the data model takes ~7 minutes

  • Selecting the query adds another ~8 minutes

  • Only after entering prompts, it takes an additional ~1 minute before I can even start building the report

This makes the development workflow almost unusable.

My questions are:

  1. Is this normal behaviour when using Power BI with SAP BW/4HANA via Application Server connectivity?

  2. Could this be related to configuration settings on the BW side or Power BI side? I’m testing a connection between Power BI Desktop and SAP BW/4HANA  which is on cloud. 

  3. Have you found better performance with Direct Query vs. Import?

I’d really appreciate any real-world experiences or best practices to understand whether this is a configuration issue on our side or simply a limitation of the connector.

Thanks in advance!

Cristina

entry.title: Course Wrap-Up and Forum Update
entry.content:
Dear course participants, 

We hope you enjoyed the SAP Expert Lecture “Discovering High-Value Opportunities for Agentic AI” and found it valuable for your professional development. 

As of today, the course discussion forum is no longer actively moderated.  

Thank you to everyone who took the time to share questions, ideas and feedback during the course period — your engagement made the learning experience richer for all. 

If you’d still like to share feedback, the following options remain available: 

  • Use the smileys below each lesson video to provide feedback on specific content. 
  • For technical or general questions, use the Feedback function in the top left corner of the SAP Learning page. 

We look forward to seeing you in a future SAP Expert Lecture. 

Thank you for choosing SAP Learning! 

Kind regards, 
Dagmar 
(SAP Learning)

entry.title: Do you know how to prepare for integrating SAP S/4HANA PEO?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Exploring SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing for Production Engineering and Operations (PEO)  learning journey.

 

Overview

This learning journey provides an in-depth functional overview of the SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing for Production Engineering and Operations (PEO) solution.

Learning objectives

  • Learners will be able to effectively set up the basic PEO processes, including creating MBOM and shop floor routing for efficient production processes and following standard procedures to ensure consistency and adherence to industry best practices.
  • Learners will demonstrate advanced proficiency in complex routing setup for unitized products, using parameter effectivity, qualifications, buyoff, and tool tracking capabilities to enrich production operations meeting industry standards.
  • Learners will possess the skills to optimize production operations and engineering changes in PEO. They will be equipped to implement process enhancements, manage major assembly projects, and drive operational efficiency within the organization.

Prerequisites

Essential: Basic knowledge of manufacturing life cycle
Recommended: SAP ERP (MM, PP, and QM modules)

Start learning

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Attachment of documents in Purchase Orders...
entry.content:
Hi @Mayuri_Srivastava 

Your client’s requirement to automatically copy attachments from the Material Master to the Purchase Order is not delivered as standard functionality in S/4HANA. Here’s how you can approach it:

  1. Here is the Standard Behaviour
  • Attachments stored in the Material Master MM02/Display Material Fiori App are managed in Generic Object Services or Document Management System.
  • Please note that by default, these attachments are not automatically inherited into transactional documents such as Purchase Orders.

 

  1. Options for On-Premise / Private Cloud
  • Enhancement via BAdI / User Exit
    • Implement the BAdI ME_GUI_PO_CUST or ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST to program logic that:
      • Reads attachments from the Material Master via GOS or DMS API.
      • Copies them to the PO at the time of PO creation.
    • This requires ABAP development and knowledge of the attachment services.
  • Use DMS with Document Info Records
    • Store attachments in Document Info Records linked to the material.
    • Configure document assignment so that when a material is referenced in a PO, the linked DIRs are available.
    • This gives more control and traceability compared to GOS attachments.
  • Workflow or Output Management Integration
    • Instead of physically attaching the file in the PO, you can configure Output Management forms, email to fetch and display the related DIRs or attachments at runtime.
    • This way, the attachments follow the process without being duplicated into the PO.

 

  1. Public Cloud Limitation
  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, such an enhancement is not possible due to clean core principles.
  • Attachments can only be managed where SAP provides standard integration for example via DMS or Attachment Services but automatic inheritance into POs cannot be customized.

Here is my workaround recommendation: Use Document Management Service on SAP BTP and link documents at runtime instead of copying them.

Integration with SAP Document Management Service, Application Option

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
